field.name: summary
field.value: SerializationException thrown when using remoting within default lifetime scope (Failed to load expression host assembly. Details: Type 'Castle.MicroKernel.Lifestyle.Scoped.CallContextLifetimeScope' in assembly 'Castle.Windsor, Version=3.0.0.0, Culture=neutral, PublicKeyToken=407dd0808d44fbdc' is not marked as serializable.)

field.name: description
field.value:
The fix not so straightforward as the exception message would have us believe.
Adding [Serializable] will serialize the scope and make it lose track of the objects it tracks. We need to fix it in a way that doesn't flow outside of the AppDomain but doesn't cause the scenario to fail.
I think one possible avenue we might explore would be to put scope-tracked objects in a static dictionary and make the scope just a gateway holding the correct key to the objects tracked by that particular scope.
This should also take parent scopes into consideration.
